items.text: LV $600 Fragrance is mainly on the fact they give you a Heavy Paper weight of a Cap.

The prices are just getting insane. It‚Äôs so hard to justify many of LV‚Äôs scents because when I bought my Afternoon Swim in 2019, it was $250 for a 100ml and $150 for a refill. I thought that was a good price range for Louis Vuitton because it was in between designer and niche pricing at the time. For $350 it‚Äôs crazy ridiculous, and symphony being as expensive as it is to me is just not worth it.

The worst part is that they think they're clever by making the fragrances weak as fuck causing us to over spray it to go through the bottle faster and then charging more money for less performance. It doesn't make any sense and I hope more people start buying dupes. They'll never change this philosophy so long as people keep buying their shit.

All of these bots in the comments hyping middle eastern fragrances lmao a dupe is a dupe and they all smell synthetic. Better save up and buy a good fragrance. I was baited as well into going for dupes and they were all so weird. just my experience tho.
I love cassili, but now I buy a clone for like 20 us dollars... smells the same and lasts longer.

I am kind of like this with Bleu de Chanel EDP, I‚Äôve continued to buy it time and time again every couple of years but cannot get anything cheaper that is ‚Äúexactly‚Äù a 1 to 1 of BDC.Davidoff, Lacoste, Diesel and so on are probably as cheap as you‚Äôll find any sort of designer fragrance today.Middle Eastern brands I don‚Äôt mind but it entirely depends on the scent profile as a lot of Middle Eastern produced fragrances are not going to appeal to the mass European markets taste unless of course there replicating mainstream designer fragrances, case in point I got on the Tiktok hype about Nocturno by Rayhaan, thats me decided I‚Äôll never go near a Dior Sauvage again, aside from the Elixir, subsequently I purchased Valhalla by Rayhaan and immediately liked how unique it was therefore their is really no need for me to consider anything else.I will say that I think Middle Eastern brands are slaying it just now and ultimately if price meets the consumers expectations of how much it should cost not what firm simply want you to pay, they‚Äôll get increased sales, I‚Äôm guessing it‚Äôs also a similar thing to the way Chinese cars are all over Europe now.

I mean shit as long as I‚Äôve always known that stuff is expensive. I used to not even buy cologne at all because of how high it is . I get I came to do research on dupes and budget friendly gems I found a lot more success and now I have a small beginners collection. But it‚Äôs one that I think it‚Äôs pretty good . I‚Äôve got just about every scent you can think of . And it took me 100 dollars less to get about 20 different bottles. To me that sounds like a way better deal than spending almost 300 dollars for 1 bottle . Idc how much money you make in life .
